name: 西方婦女史研討
goals: Understanding the Impact of History on Gender
Using English to Discuss Gender Issues
syllabus:
Syllabus: 16+2 weeks

1 Introduction

2 A Defect: Women in Ancient Greece

3 Law, Women and Society in Ancient Rome

4 Anglo-Saxon Women: law and women

5 Marriage, Property and Family

6 'Did Women Have Renaissance?'

7 Motherhiid

8 Women and Sexuality

9 Film week

10 Women Sexuality

11 Women and Their Mind

12 Dissendents: witches, prostitutes and criminals 

13 Women and Industrial Revolution

14 Suffragtte and Feminism: a path to gender equality

15 Notorius RBG

16 FInal Examination

17 Film week 1

18 Film week 2

methodologies.note: The course is in English only. Taught programme.
Group discussion is required in every class.
Each group should be fully engage in and contribute to the discussion.
Teaching materials include selected movies and documentaries relevant to the course.

grading.note: Students should pick a topic touches on Medieval English Women, and have a 10-min discussion in English with teacher. The examination will be conducted one by one. Students can only enter the classroom to have the examination when their turns come.
Group Discussion is mandatory, following up each lecture.
Roll call every class. Each student can only take two absences.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
